item.title: Trees on Telstar Way, 15th July
item.description:
Some of the trees on the verge between Telstar Way and the rear of houses on Gemini Close are touching 2 Gemini Close and have potential to cause damage. These have been previously cut back successfully on two occasions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Gemini Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Button lights up, but turns off without triggering green signal, 15th July
item.description:
The traffic signal doesn’t turn green, the button just turns off and I had to try pressing again. This means waiting two full cycles of traffic, or longer, an unacceptable amount of time which will discourage cyclists commuting on the path. The same issue is happening at many of the traffic lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fallen down , blocking road, 15th July
item.description:
A large chunk of the tree has fallen down and it blocking the path and some of the road. Right in front of the lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Saint Georges Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle crossing not working (intermittent), 14th July
item.description:
Over past three weeks, several times I have stopped on the cycle track and pushed the button to cross. The button definitely lights up and I wait, after a while the button light turns off even though the cycle crossing hasn’t gone green yet. I have to either try and ride through traffic, or press the button and wait for another full cycle of road lights before I can cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously leaning Ash Tree on West Drive, 14th July
item.description:
Having previously reported this leaning Ash Tree opposite Rose Cottage on West Drive 2-3months ago, no corrective action has been taken. The tree has moved further and is now resting on the nearby lamppost. If something is not done urgently, the (relatively) new light will also be damaged and costs will escalate significantly - clearly far from desirable! It also poses a serious safety risks to the public and particularly children from the nearby school

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Large tree branches down in cul-de-sac, 14th July
item.description:
Two large tree branch came down this evening (14th July) across the cul-de-sac. Neighbours dragged them off the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Piccadilly Way, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roads too narrow, cars keep being scratched, 14th July
item.description:
Union street, york street & Sherborne street. Union and York street are extremely narrow roads and since I have moved here a month ago… I’ve seen 8 cars being scratched by cars passing by or parking… including my own twice. It is not safe and parents from a nearby school parking in a rush does not help the situation. In addition, the corner leaving York street onto Sherborne street has had footpaths widened that do not allow for larger cars to smoothly turn the corner so they are often forced to use the curb to avoid touching the parked cars. Ideally the pavements in these areas need narrowing or parking should be restricted on one side of the road. I do not feel safe parking my car on this road or any roads nearby due to this issue and have spoken to neighbours that has expressed the same concern. I understand that parking is limited in these areas, however, hearing how many people feel anxious about parking their cars, it needs to be address, especially considering how many cars and vans I’ve seen trying to speed through this road (York st) in an unsafe manner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, York Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
